title: Bertil Nordahl
text:
Bertil Nordahl (26 July 1917 – 1 December 1998) was a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
He played for <a href="Degerfors%20IF">Degerfors IF</a> and <a href="Atalanta%20B.C.">Atalanta B.C.</a>. He won the gold medal at the <a href="1948%20Summer%20Olympics">1948 Summer Olympics</a>, along with his brothers <a href="Knut%20Nordahl">Knut</a> and <a href="Gunnar%20Nordahl">Gunnar Nordahl</a>.
After the Olympics, he and Gunnar transferred to <a href="Italy">Italy</a> and, due to being in a professional football league while the Swedish football was all amateur, they were not called to the <a href="1950%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1950 FIFA World Cup</a>.
He was capped 15 times for the <a href="Sweden%20national%20football%20team">Sweden national football team</a>.
After his playing career, he coached <a href="%C3%96rebro%20SK">Örebro SK</a> and <a href="IK%20Brage">IK Brage</a>.
